title: Header and Nav
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (12.0 or greater)
And user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
custom_steps: WHEN user logs in
custom_expected: THEN the user is shown the Home Tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the Profile avatar is displayed at the top left, shown as a initials or silhouette*

*If name associated with acct - Initials shown
*If name NOT associated with acct - silhouette

AND the header section displays the strings provided by the contextual home service: `welcomeMessage, Name(if user acct associated with name` and `toDoMessage` (Example: 'Welcome, Ballpark User' and 'Let's find you a game.')
AND the chatbot icon, if feature is enabled

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user has unread message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND the inbox icon is displayed at the top right, shown as a envelope image
AND the inbox icon indicates there are unread message with Ballpark blue indicator dot

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user has NO unread message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
AND the inbox icon is displayed at the top right, shown as a envelope image
AND the inbox icon indicates all messages have been read without Ballpark blue indicator dot

title: At Venue NOT During a Ticketed Event
custom_preconds:
As a fan attending an event who loves My History & Check In offers and is interested in venue only experiences, I want to know when I view the home tab that I’m in the venue

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND there is NOT a ticketed game event
AND user's device has location permissions (precise) enabled for Ballpark App on the device
AND user's device is located at the venue (can be mocked)
custom_steps: WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
custom_expected: THEN I’ll see a welcome to the venue message and a header image

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a welcome to the venue message and a header image

*Header Image and Text are passed into the Firestore doc generated by HomeServices

title: At Venue  During a Ticketed Event
custom_preconds:
As a fan attending an event who loves My History & Check In offers and is interested in venue only experiences, I want to know when I view the home tab that I’m in the venue

GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user satisfies all conditions needed to allow an auto-checkin to occur


Note to complete a check-in User must:
* have location permissions (precise) enabled for Ballpark App on the device
* have device located at the venue (can be mocked)
* have a home game scheduled at the team venue within 3 hrs of device time AND also prior to after 6 hrs of game time (can be mocked)

NOTE: Venue Header and Auto Check-in features are ticket agnostic, meaning that expected behavior should be verified both with AND without tickets
custom_steps: WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
custom_expected:
THEN I’ll see a welcome to the venue message and a header image
AND the user should be automatically checked-in

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
AND the user does NOT have tickets for the event intended to check-in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a welcome to the venue message and a header image

*Header Image and Text are passed into the Firestore doc generated by HomeServices

AND user is shown an indicator that user has been automatically checked-in to the event

** typically something like 'Go to My History' context card, 'Unlocked Offer' context card, etc.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user proceeds to My History page

** typically via context card button, deeplink, or manually tapping through My Profile
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the event listed in the user's history as latest entry with capability to Add/Edit the event (such as Add New Photos, Edit seat/note details)

custom_steps_separated.content: (note: if using the same account to verify with and without tickets, ensure that the event check-in has been removed/deleted, prior to proceeding)

WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
AND the user has tickets for the event intended to check-in
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a welcome to the venue message and a header image

*Header Image and Text are passed into the Firestore doc generated by HomeServices

AND user is shown an indicator that user has been automatically checked-in to the event

** typically something like 'Go to My History' context card, 'Unlocked Offer' context card, etc.

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user proceeds to My History page

** typically via home page button, deeplink, or manually tapping through My Profile
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown the event listed in the user's history as latest entry with capability to Add/Edit the event (such as Add New Photos, Edit seat/note details)

title: Venue message and a header image - default image
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.5.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user's device has location permissions (precise) enabled for Ballpark App on the device


Requires oktaID for account used to verify behavior and access to firebase (with desired env applied) 
ex: steve.ortiz@mlb.com / 00u7jfuq8p4KfAiKe357 / Staging
https://console.firebase.google.com/u/0/project/mlb-ballpark-app-831/firestore/data/~2Fhometab-staging~2F00u7jfuq8p4KfAiKe357
custom_steps:
WHEN user's device is located at an available venue (can be mocked)
AND Firestore doc for the user returns empty strings, invalid strings, and/or deleted entries

Header Fields within Firestore:
*imageOverlayText
*imageURL

setting 'lock' value to 'true' assists with validation
custom_expected:
THEN the Ballpark app handles each case appropriately 
such as:
*header text removed, when empty imageOverlayText
*default venue image shown, when imageURL field removed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user's device is located at an available venue (can be mocked)
AND Firestore doc for the user returns 
*imageOverlayText => ""
*imageURL present and accurate

WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a header image for the correct venue 
AND the welcome to the venue message is NOT shown (since empty field passed into imageOverlayText)

*Header Image and Text are passed into the Firestore doc generated by HomeServices

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user's device is located at an available venue (can be mocked)
AND Firestore doc for the user returns 
*imageOverlayText removed from Firestore doc
*imageURL present and accurate

WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown a header image for the correct venue 
AND the welcome to the venue message is NOT shown (since imageOverlayText is not present )

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user's device is located at an available venue (can be mocked)
AND Firestore doc for the user returns 
*imageOverlayText => present and accurate
*imageURL => "any_text_that_doesnt_map_correctly" 

WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is shown the default header image (since imageURL field isn't accurate)
AND the welcome to the venue message is shown

*default image will not be of any other venue, instead using a generic venue image

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user's device is located at an available venue (can be mocked)
AND Firestore doc for the user returns 
*imageOverlayText => present and accurate
*imageURL removed from Firestore doc 

WHEN the user open the app to Home Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is NOT shown a header image (since empty field passed into imageURL)
AND user is not shown the welcome to the venue message (since no image passed to overlay the text)
AND user is shown the location header (such as 'Baltimore, MD')

AND user is on the home page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN device time is set between 4AM to 9:59AM, inclusively
AND user is on the home page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN welcome message in the Header includes 'Good morning.'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN device time is set between 10AM to 12:59PM, inclusively
AND user is on the home page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN welcome message in the Header includes 'Welcome.'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN device time is set between 1PM to 4:59PM, inclusively
AND user is on the home page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN welcome message in the Header includes 'Good afternoon.'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN device time is set between 5PM to 11:59PM, inclusively
AND user is on the home page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN welcome message in the Header includes 'Good evening.'

title: To Do Message - Unverified Acct w/ Game Event Tickets
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
And user is logged in with an unverified MLB account in Ballpark app
And user has Game event tickets in future (greater than 60 hrs away from startTime)

** Obtain startTimeUTC value from HomeService/Firestore doc for Next Ticketed Event 

*Testing Notes:[How to test Ballpark Features with an Unverified Account with Tickets](https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/BET/pages/2587656220/How+to+test+Ballpark+Features+with+an+Unverified+Account+with+Tickets)
custom_steps: WHEN desired conditions(tickets within 60 hrs, startDate=deviceDate) are in place
custom_expected: THEN the appropriate welcomeText and toDoText(passed from HomeService) is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN unverified user device date & time is greater than 60 hours of event start date & time
AND user is on the home page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the header is displayed with welcomeText on first line
AND welcomeText has value of [Welcome message] -- this is based on TimeOfDay (example: 'Good morning' when time is between 4AM and 9:59AM)

AND the header is displayed with toDoText on second line
AND toDoText has value of "Here's your next game."

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN unverified user device date & time is less than 60 hours of event start date & time, BUT also not the startDate of event
AND user is on the home page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the header is displayed with welcomeText on first line
AND welcomeText has value of "[Welcome message]. It's almost game day!"

AND the header is displayed with toDoText on second line
AND toDoText has value of "Let's get you ready."

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN unverified user device date & time is the same as the startDate of event
AND user is on the home page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the header is displayed with welcomeText on first line
AND welcomeText has value of "[Welcome message]. Today is game day."

AND the header is displayed with toDoText on second line
AND toDoText has value of "Let's go!"

title: Verified Primary Account for Game Event
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the Primary email for the account is verified
AND a game event is returned from box office ticketing service upcoming API
custom_steps:
WHEN the primary email for the account is verified
AND user on the home tab
custom_expected:
THEN user will see event information 
AND be able to access tickets for forwarding or scanning

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN a game event is returned for future date
AND user navigates to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be shown Next Ticketed Event Card
AND user is able to access tickets for forwarding or scanning

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user examines the Next Ticketed Event Card
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN startTime/startTIimeLocalText is displayed as day of the week, date, and local time of event is shown within the Next Ticketed Event(NTE) card

Example: 'Tue, Apr 20 - 7:00 PM ET'

AND title is shown of the game event within the NTE card

Example: 'Nationals @ Orioles'

AND venueName is displayed within the NTE card

Example: 'Oriole Park'

AND description is displayed within the NTE card (if description provided in service call)

Example: '<Game Description>'

AND the background color of the NTE card is the primary color of the Home Team 

Example: Orange color for Orioles

AND the background image of the NTE card is shown matching what is passed in the service call 

Example: field/stadium image of the home team

AND the home team logo is shown within the NTE card (if logoPngURL/logoSvgURL for specific OS provided in service call)

Example: 'Orioles team logo'

AND 'Open Tickets' button is shown attached to NTE card
AND the color of 'Open Tickets' text is the primary color of the Home Team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Open Tickets' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the scanview of the tickets 

Example deeplink: ballpark://scanview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user analyzes the tickets shown in the scanview
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user can access tickets 
AND user has capability to forward or scan the tickets

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user dismisses the scanview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to Home page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps the NTE card (above 'Open Tickets' button)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is directed to the deeplink provided in the service call, typically the listview of the tickets 

Example deeplink: ballpark://listview?eventID=12345&teamID=109 (where the eventID and teamID match the appropriate event)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps back nav on listview of the tickets
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is returned to the Home page

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN engineer accesses the Firestore doc hometab service using the acct's oktaID
AND engineer analyzes NTE card (sections > cards > cardID 'nextTicketedEvent'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN reportingString is shown as "Home : Next Ticketed Event"

title: Verified Account for Multiple Events on Same Day
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND the Primary email for the account is verified
AND multiple events are returned from box office ticketing service upcoming API
custom_steps: WHEN user is on the home tab with multiple events on the same day
custom_expected:

title: Error state (Network ON, HomeService Unavailable)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user downloaded the Ballpark app (10.2.0 or greater)
AND user is logged in with MLB account in Ballpark app
AND user does not have cached data for today’s date 
AND the home service is unavailable
custom_steps: WHEN user is on the home tab
custom_expected:
THEN user is shown a Context Card with a message explaining to me the situation and a link to see tickets
* subject: Sorry
* body: We’re having a little trouble personalizing your Home tab right now. You can always see your tickets and team schedules over on the Tickets tab.
* CTA: “Go to Tickets” deeplink to ballpark://wallet

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user has network connection 
AND the home service is currently unavailable **
AND the user does not have cache data for today
AND user is on the home tab



** To simulate Home Service unavailable - use Charles and had breakpoint to request 
* bphometab.mobile.mlbinfra.com - Staging
* bphometab.mobileqa.mlbinfra.com - QA

** To simulate No Cache data. either
* onboard a newly created account OR
* prior to login of an existing acct, delete firestore doc and log in to acct for newly installed BP app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user will be shown 'Sorry' Context Card
AND user is able to see tickets via 'Go to Tickets' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user examines the Sorry Context Card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the title/subject of the card is displayed as 'Sorry'
AND the body of the card is displayed as 'We’re having a little trouble personalizing your Home tab right now. You can always see your tickets and team schedules over on the Tickets tab'
AND 'Go to Tickets' button is shown

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps 'Go to Tickets' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to Tickets tabs (via deeplink of ballpark://wallet)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user returns back to Home tab
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user will be shown 'Sorry' Context Card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN home service is restored
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is shown updated Home tab
